business.headline: Will Q3 results deepen Dalal Street sell-off? 3 stocks to watch amid uncertaintySensex and Nifty plunged over 1.5%, and the Nifty PSU Bank suffered a loss of close to 4% in Monday's bloodbath on Dalal Street, reflecting weak investor sentiment, dampened market conditions and uncertainty.

Explained: Why MobiKwik share price jumped nearly 12% despite reporting Q2 lossMobikwik stock price today: The sharp rally came despite the company reporting a consolidated net loss of Rs 3.59 crore in Q2 FY25, compared to a profit of Rs 5.23 crore in Q2 FY24.
SBI Har Ghar Lakhpati Scheme: Eligibility, features and interest rates explained SBI's Har Ghar Lakhpati RD helps individuals achieve Rs 1 lakh with small monthly investments and attractive returns.

Budget 2025: Will new income tax regime steal the spotlight again?Budget 2025 tax expectations: The upcoming budget may focus on the new income tax regime yet again to increase its appeal compared to the old tax regime.

ITR filing: Technical glitch keeps Section 87A rebate unavailable for taxpayersTaxpayers remain unable to claim the Section 87A rebate on STCG income due to outdated ITR processing logic, even after recent updates to filing forms by the Income Tax Department.

Is Zomato's dream stock market run over? Zomato's share price has declined over 9% in the past 5 trading sessions and over 14% in a month. At around 12:05 pm, shares of the company were trading 4.38% lower at Rs 253.05.

Delta Autocorp IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band and other detailsDelta Autocorp IPO open for bidding: The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 54.60 crore, comprising a fresh issue of 38.88 lakh shares amounting to Rs 50.54 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.12 lakh shares, aggregating to Rs 4.06 crore.

Budget 2025: Trade Unions join pre-budget discussions with Nirmala SitharamanBudget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held pre-Budget talks with trade unions to shape the Union Budget 2025-26, focusing on economic challenges and growth ahead of its February 1 presentation.

Stock market recovers after yesterday's crash. What's next on Dalal Street?Stock market recovery today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.11 points to 78,219.10 at 11:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 115.75 points to trade at 23,735.10.

Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Check GMP, price band, subscription Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares.
Explained: Why Biocon share price jumped over 7% todayBiocon stock price: At around 10:45 am, shares of the company were trading 7.22% higher at Rs 384.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Zomato share price falls as Jefferies downgrade; target price cut to Rs 275At 10:33 am, Zomato's stock price was down 4.19% to Rs 253.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the shares of Zomato hit an intra-day low of Rs 251.55.
Indo Farm Equipment shares list at 19% premium over IPO price Indo Farm Equipment stock price: The company's shares were listed at Rs 256 each on the NSE, a 19.07% gain from the issue price.

Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO opens for bidding. Check key dates, price bandThe IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 1,578 crore, which includes a fresh issue of 10.77 crore shares amounting to Rs 1,077 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore shares aggregating to Rs 501 crore.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as Dalal Street rebounds from HMPV virus scareStock market rebounds: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 369.05 points to 78,334.04, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 151.40 points to 23,767.50 as of 9:20 AM.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO listing: Will it make a strong market debut? Indo Farm Equipment share price: The Indo Farm Equipment IPO saw bumper investor interest, achieving one of the highest subscription rates in recent times on its final day.

Stocks to watch today: Vodafone Idea, RIL, Adani Power, Indo Farm EquipmentStocks of Indo Farm Equipment, RIL, Adani Power, Mobikwik, BPCL, RIL, Bharti Airtel, Coal India, among others, are expected to remain in focus as trading resumes today, January 7, 2025.

Stock market today: Will volatility continue to haunt Dalal Street?Concerns over the HMPV virus and foreign institutional investors (FIIs) pulling out funds triggered a massive sell-off, leaving the Sensex and Nifty both over 1.5% lower.
ITR filing: Why you should declare foreign assets by January 15Indian residents must disclose foreign assets and income in their ITRs by January 15, 2025, to maintain compliance and avoid penalties.

EPFO 3.0 launch date announced: Check ATM withdrawal feature, other detailsEPFO 3.0, launching by June 2025, will offer ATM-based withdrawals, flexible contributions, and improved features, transforming retirement fund management.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 95 dead, 130 injured after multiple earthquakes in Tibet; tremors felt in IndiaTremors were felt in Delhi-NCR and many parts of North India on Tuesday following a 7.1 magnitude earthquake in Tibet, near the Nepal border.

Delhi assembly election dates to be announced at 2 pmDelhi Election Date: The Election Commission of India (ECI) is set to announce the dates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections at 2 pm on Tuesday.

2 children detected with HMPV in Nagpur, total cases in India increase to 7  Live UpdatesOn January 3, the children were taken to a private hospital in the city's Ramdaspeth area for fever and cough treatment. After tests were conducted, hospital authorities confirmed that the two were infected with HMPV.

US cop who killed Indian student in Seattle with patrol car firedSeattle police officer Kevin Dave, who killed Indian student Jaahnavi Kandula in January 2023 by striking her with his patrol vehicle while driving at over 119 km/h, has been dismissed from the force.

Timelapse video shows how Isro's crops sprouted green leaves in spaceThis experiment is part of Isro's ongoing efforts to explore sustainable agricultural practices in space, which are crucial for future long-duration missions.

Rape convict Asaram Bapu gets interim bail on medical groundsThe Supreme Court directed the 86-year-old Asaram Bapu, who is serving a life sentence in a rape case, not to meet his followers after his release.

Who will replace Trudeau as Canada PM? Indian-origin Anita Anand among contendersDespite his announcement to resign on Monday, the 53-year-old embattled leader confirmed he would remain in office until the ruling Liberal Party chooses his successor. Canada's parliament will also remain suspended until March 24.

AAP dubs Amit Shah as 'Chunavi Muslim' as poster war heats up ahead of pollsDelhi Elections: The AAP's tit-for-tat attack comes days after the BJP released a poster calling Arvind Kejriwal a 'chunavi (electoral) Hindu' for promising Rs 18,000 monthly compensation to priests.

Pics: Salman Khan shields his Mumbai home with bulletproof glass amid threatsSalman Khan has bolstered his Galaxy Apartment security with bulletproof glass and electric fencing following several death threats from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang.

Shami should have been in Australia: Ravi Shastri slams India's injury managementAustralia vs India: Senior fast bowler Mohammed Shami missed the entire Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to injury concerns. India felt the absence of the senior fast bowler as they lost the series 1-3.

Shedding crocodile tears: Ramesh Bidhuri on Atishi breaking down over his jibeOn Monday, Atishi broke down during a press conference while speaking about Ramesh Bidhuri's remarks on her father. The BJP leader said the AAP was used to playing the victim card.

Sam Altman says OpenAI is losing money because of ChatGPT Pro subscriptionOpenAI CEO Sam Altman says ChatGPT Pro is so popular that the company is actually losing money because of it. The company didn't expect so many people to subscribe to it.

Don't ask political questions: Rajinikanth's absurd reply on women's safetySuperstar Rajinikanth refused to answer questions about women's safety in Tamil Nadu. On January 7, he was seen at the Chennai airport as he left for Thailand for Coolie shoot.

Symptoms to expert advice: Your detailed HMPV guideHuman metapneumovirus (HMPV) is garnering attention due to rising cases in China and advisories in Indian states like Karnataka and Maharashtra. While it's not a new virus, concerns are heightened because of limited research and public awareness. Here's everything you need to know about the virus.

Unni Mukundan: 300 litres blood used in Marco, could have lost my eye | ExclusiveMarco actor Unni Mukundan risked his eyesight during the shoot of the film due to the use of a blood-like chemical substance. He also shared that almost 300 litres of the substance was used during the filming.

Gill is highly overrated, India should pick Gaikwad or Sudharsan: SrikkanthIND vs AUS: Former India captain Kris Srikkanth slammed Shubman Gill for his performances in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, questioning him for his below-par contribution.

Nayanthara documentary row: Chandramukhi makers deny suing actor for Rs 5 croreReports of a lawsuit against Nayanthara's documentary have been dismissed. A No Objection Certificate from the Chandramukhi makers, clearing legal concerns over footage usage, is now widely circulating on social media.
How to onboard Indian men into family planningThe 2030 Family Planning Vision aims to make engaging men a policy priority to abate worries on female sterilisation

What triggered the multiple earthquakes in Tibet that killed 53?The earthquake had a shallow depth of just 10 kilometres, which contributed to the intensity of the tremors felt across neighboring regions, including Nepal, Bhutan, and parts of northern India.

Fir layenge Kejriwal: AAP launches campaign song for Delhi polls The launch event was attended by Delhi Chief Minister Atishi, AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal, and AAP leaders Manish Sisodia and Sanjay Singh among others.

Did Demi Moore snub Kylie Jenner at Golden Globes? Her daughter reactsA video from the Golden Globes where Demi Moore is seen greeting Elle Fanning and 'snubbing' Kylie Jenner went viral. Moore's daughter Tallulah reacted to the video and defended her mother.

Trudeau knew this and resigned: What Trump said after Canadian PM's moveTrump revived his pitch to make Canada the 51st US state after Trudeau's resignation, sparking debate over trade, security, and sovereignty. Canadian officials remain silent on the bold proposal.

Macron accuses Elon Musk of poll interference, he counters with dig at StarmerElon Musk recently accused UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer of being complicit in grooming gang cases, a charge the Labour Party leader strongly denied, calling it misinformation.

Prashant Kishor suffers from dehydration, throat infection as he continues fastBPSC protest: Prashant Kishor was arrested for his "illegal fast unto death" on Monday. He was released on bail later in the day and now continues his hunger strike at his residence in Patna.

Explained: Tragedy at Game Changer event, release trouble for film in Tamil NaduAhead of its grand release, Ram Charan's Game Changer got embroiled in many controversies. Two fans died in a road accident after attending the film's event in Andhra Pradesh.

Amid fan wars, what it means when ARMY says 'BTS paved the way' | Explained The phrase 'BTS paved the way' signifies BTS' monumental role in expanding K-pop's global reach. While acknowledging the contributions of earlier groups like BIGBANG, BTS' journey is seen as a turning point in the industry.

sports.headline: India eye hosting Javelin World Championship ft Neeraj Chopra in 2029India is set to host a star-studded global javelin competition headlined by Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra, alongside expressing interest in hosting marquee athletics events, including the 2029 World Championships, to cement its growing presence in international athletics.

People forget what Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have achieved: Yuvraj SinghYuvraj Singh has defended Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli amidst mounting criticism over their form during India's Border-Gavaskar Trophy defeat, emphasising their immense contributions to Indian cricket and urging patience as they navigate through a challenging phase.

Watch: AC Milan coach Sergio Conceicao flaunts dance moves after Supercoppa winSergio Conceicao's stunning debut week at AC Milan saw him clinch the Supercoppa Italiana in a thrilling 3-2 win over Inter Milan, becoming the fastest coach in the club's history to win a trophy.

In Champions Trophy, every ball has a consequence: Shane WatsonFormer Australia all-rounder Shane Watson hyped up the Championship Trophy, which is returning after a hiatus of 7 years. Watson called the format exciting, stating that every ball had a consequence in the tournament.

Saim Ayub heads to London for treatment after ankle injurySaim Ayub travelled to London from Cape Town to get an expert opinion on his ankle injury as the Pakistan Cricket Board was racing against time to get him fit for next month's Champions Trophy.

Injured Australia pacer Josh Hazlewood set to miss Sri Lanka seriesAustralia face a setback as pacer Josh Hazlewood is set to miss the Sri Lanka tour due to injury, leaving a gap in the fast-bowling lineup alongside captain Pat Cummins' absence.

Manchester City's Rodri shares major injury return update: Everything going well Ballon d'Or winner Rodri is set to return from his ACL injury, offering Manchester City a much-needed boost amidst a turbulent season. With City's midfield struggling in his absence, his comeback could reignite their faltering Premier League campaign.

Sir Alex Ferguson, Beckham pay respects to Manchester United icon Kath PhippsSir Alex Ferguson, along with former and current Manchester United players like David Beckham, paid tribute to Kath Phipps, former club receptionist, at a funeral service on Monday.

Has Border-Gavaskar Trophy surpassed popularity of Ashes? Ponting explainsIND vs AUS: The Border-Gavaskar Trophy was the fourth most attended Test series in the history of Australian cricket. Has the BGT surpassed the popularity of the iconic Ashes in recent years?

South Africa know how to beat Australia: Rabada's WTC final warning to CumminsSouth Africa pacer Kagiso Rabada has issued a warning to Australia ahead of the World Test Championship (WTC) final, saying that the Proteas know how to beat the Pat Cummins-led side.

Smith attributes missing out on 10,000 Test runs milestone to tough SCG pitchVeteran Australian batter Steve Smith has opened up on narrowly missing reaching the milestone of 10,000 career runs during the five-match Test series against India for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Babar Azam stepped up when we lost Saim: Shan Masood hails Pakistan's fightbackBabar Azam's resilience shone despite Pakistan's loss, with a stellar performance alongside Shan Masood. However, Masood emphasised the need for the team to capitalise on key moments, stressing the importance of learning to win in crucial situations.

Rampaging South Africa script fairy-tale comeback to confirm WTC top spot SA vs PAK: With their 10-wicket win over Pakistan in the New Year's Test, South Africa confirmed their top spot in the WTC 2023-25. South Africa started 2024 with three losses and a draw before going on a seven-match winning streak.

Konstas opens up on 'special' Test, recalls cousin, grandfather's death Border Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: Young Australian batter Sam Konstas said that the Pink Test holds a special place for him since the SCG Test helps in spreading awareness about cancer.

South Africa overcome Pakistan's stoic resistance to win New Year's Test, sweep series 2-0South Africa's dominance continues with a 10-wicket win over Pakistan, marking their seventh straight Test victory. Rickelton's double ton and Maharaj's key strikes shone, while Pakistan's valiant fight in the follow-on wasn't enough to avoid defeat.

Naomi Osaka 'optimistic' about Australian Open after painful Auckland exit  Naomi Osaka was confident of getting fit before the Australian Open after sustaining an abdominal injury that forced her out of the ASB Classic final against Clara Tauson on Sunday.

Ravi Shastri reveals admiration for Pat Cummins since coaching era: He amazes meRavi Shastri lauded Pat Cummins' captaincy after Australia's 3-1 BGT triumph, praising his competitive spirit and resilience. Shastri, recalling India's Test wins in Australia under his tenure, highlighted Cummins' determination and never-say-die attitude.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
